attributes.action: Government should continue annual  breast examinations with a breast surgeon
attributes.background: Current Breast cancer follow-up includes yearly mammogram with breast examination with a breast surgeon and request additional tests for 5 years. NHS has now started implementing new open access (stratified) follow up pathway with no  annual breast examinations with a breast surgeon
attributes.additional_details: Patients will only have a mammogram and no breast examination by surgeon.Ladies has to rely on their own examination skills, which is very dangerous.This will risk patients lives. Mammograms are not sensitive and needs to be complemented by breast examination and other investigations +_ tissue sampling.Govt should continue annual mandatory breast examinations  by breast surgeon and stop implementing this dangerous stratified followup pathway.

attributes.action: Make basic equality training a legal requirement for businesses
attributes.background: The equality act 2010 is a wonderful piece of legislation that protects people from discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: If you've ever been treated unfairly due to your disability, age, race or gender, it is there to protect you but what happens when someone or a company does it and refuses to change? Nothing a lot of the time and it's not right! People and companies need to be educated on the equality act and make reasonable adjustments where necessary.

attributes.action: A Fair Parenting law so that both parents get equal child benefits.
attributes.background: Parents should receive benefits - Child Benefit, Disability Benefit or Carers allowance - for the period their child stays with them.
attributes.additional_details: Parents, particularly disabled parents, need help to feed and clothe their child for the time their children are with them. Parents are having to use food banks because the benefits that should follow the child stay with the resident parent no matter where the child is actually staying.

attributes.action: A 2nd Brexit referendum should allow 17 year olds on electoral registers to vote
attributes.background: Brexit will affect the UK for generations to come, and in particular the future of our young people.  As with the referendum on Scottish Independence, it is only right therefore that more of them should be given a say.
attributes.additional_details: Ideally such a vote should be extended to all eligible 16 and 17 year olds in the UK, but I recognise that there is unlikely to be enough time to enact this before a second Brexit Referendum, if there is one.  However, electoral rolls should already include the names of 17 year old household occupants.

attributes.action: Ban all plastic straws by 2021.
attributes.background: Plastic straws are currently heavily polluting our oceans and causing significant harm to our Sea Life. A recent video released shows a sea turtle with a straw stuck in its nostril. The pain and suffering caused to creatures and the damage to the environment is unnecessary as there are alternatives.

attributes.action: Stop the manufacture and importation of non biodegradable plastics
attributes.background: Our planet is choking on non bio degradable plastics. We need to act NOW and immediately stop the manufacture and importation of these life threatening products.

attributes.action: Reclassify the antihistamine fexofenadine hydrochloride from POM to P.
attributes.background: There should be greater availability of more powerful antihistamines which can help to reverse the allergic reaction process in the very early stages. Fexofenadine hydrochloride is available at pharmacies in many European countries, UAE, Japan and Australia.
attributes.additional_details:
According to Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency (May, 2016) as part of a freedom of information request, the drug remains as classified as a prescription only medicine (POM) in the UK.
Many deaths could be prevented as a result of reclassification to P, where the drug can be made more accessible by being issued under the supervision of a pharmacist.

attributes.action: Reduce the drink-drive limit to 0.05, reducing it to 0.02 in a few years
attributes.background: I was watching Trust me I'm a Doctor on the BBC and the drink drive limit has not been altered since inception in 1967, despite science moving on. When it was set at 0.08, it was believed this doubled the risk of a fatal collision, it is now known to be 13 times higher.
attributes.additional_details: Road safety expert Professor Richard Allsopp, who set the original limit, states that he would now not choose that limit. He recommends a reduction to 0.05 (the same as Scotland), reducing to 0.02 in a few years (the same as the rest of Europe). He estimated that the reduction to 0.05 would save 25 lives a year. I want the Ministry of Transport to implement this and accept that the limit is currently far too high for safety. Ours is one of the highest blood alcohol limits in the world.

attributes.action: Repeal Welfare Reform Act 2012 and ban outright zero hours contracts
attributes.background: The Welfare Reform Act 2012 and zero hours contracts are causing huge levels of social deprivation and poverty impacting significantly on disabled and vulnerable people which must be stopped.

attributes.action: Change English law such that an offer on a house is a binding contract
attributes.background: Making it a more binding contract to offer on a house would help speed up moving house and prevent people spending thousands of pounds only for their buyer to withdraw or the seller to accept to a higher bid. This is how the system works in Scotland.
attributes.additional_details: Twice this year I have accepted offers on my property and spent money in solicitors fees only for them to pull out. I think once an offer is made on a property it should be made harder in law for a person to pull out of buying that property.

attributes.action: Pass a law restricting the promotion and display of alcoholic beverages in shops
attributes.background: Shops must be more responsible by not displaying alcoholic beverages at the front of the shop where people are forced to pass by it. They should limit the use of promotional marketing so as not to encourage people to purchase alcohol, particularly vulnerable & disadvantaged people in society.
attributes.additional_details: Thousands die from alcohol-related diseases every year. The cost and burden on the NHS is vast. It is the second biggest preventable killer behind smoking. The negative impact of alcohol is worse than smoking because it takes away a persons dignity, self esteem and ruins the lives of family and loved ones. Banning advertising of cigarettes has reduced smoking-related illness. Alcohol should be no different. For example, Tesco should not be having a 'Drinks Festival' a campaign encouraging people to drink.

attributes.action: Allow England to form a devolved Government.
attributes.background: Scotland, Northern Ireland and Wales have freedom to make their own decisions and choices with a devolved democracy. England however has to follow the laws that Westminster agrees. It is not fair that these countries get to vote and have an input on decisions that affect our lives but not their own.
attributes.additional_details:
E.g Scotland can contribute to the decision over the future of our NHS, something of which doesn't not affect themselves.
If we had a devolved democracy, England would have the right to freedom. Let our lives be determined by our own decisions and not because of others; with a devolved democracy this is made possible.

attributes.action: Require teachers to wear a uniform
attributes.background: Pupils have to wear uniforms for numerous reasons and if not are punished and sent home even if parents cannot afford it. I think it would be fair for teachers to have to wear them too to set examples to the students and also for security reasons to help prevent non staff members being on site.
attributes.additional_details: When not supposed to be on site, it will also help them to be identified by the pupils and parents etc. I strongly believe that figures in authority should lead by the examples they lead and follow the same rules as the pupils with uniforms and piercing and hair cuts etc police ambulance firefighters etc all wear uniforms so teachers should too.

attributes.action: Call for an immediate halt to the offense on Idlib and an international debate
attributes.background:
Our prime minister must join those applying pressure on Russia and Iran to stop such an onslaught. Apply pressure on the UN to do what it can in calling for diplomacy. 
Find ways to help the civilians to protect themselves and deal with the humanitarian disaster which looms.
attributes.additional_details: Let us not stand by and watch whilst another humanitarian crisis unfolds. We must raise our voices in opposition!

attributes.action: Ban perpetrators of domestic violence representing themselves in family court
attributes.background: In domestic abuse cases in family court, the abuser continues to abuse and control their victim by choosing to self-represent. This is a way for them to obtain personal information i.e. medical records about their victim.
attributes.additional_details: Women’s aid are aware of the perpetrators motives and are in agreement the way family courts are run needs to change. Women are losing their children due to domestic abuse even when they leave the abuser the abuse still continues. The abuser uses the family court to obtain personal information on their victim by self-representing. This needs to be stopped. The criminal courts have put this in place so why not the civil courts? Women are being put through massive amount of stress during these proceedings when the protection can be put there! Cafcass also need in-depth training on domestic abuse.

attributes.action: Educate children and teenagers about Learning Disabilities and Mental Health
attributes.background: 1 in 4 people will have a mental health illness. 1 in 50 people have a learning disability. These figures are increasing and everyone will come into contact with people with mental health issues and learning disabilities on a regular basis. So it is important to know and understand these disorders.
attributes.additional_details: A lack of understanding and fear of the unknown is causing people with Mental Health and Learning Disabilities to become increasingly vulnerable and separated from society. To integrate everyone, including the Mental health and Learning Disability population, creating awareness and understand should decrease behaviours, such as bullying and mate crime, which is significantly higher for vulnerable people. Educating people from a young age should make these stigmatized groups more accepted.

attributes.action: Remove multiple minor convictions from DBS from over 10 years ago
attributes.background: If someone has more than one minor offence from over 10 years ago, they still appear on the DBS Disclosure and Barring Service. People are refused jobs as a result, even though there’s nothing serious on there. This means that they unfairly continue to suffer for stupid mistakes made when young.
attributes.additional_details:
There should be an order so that multiple convictions can be removed after 10 years. The major ones should stay on for life, for example, if anyone is on the sex register, someone who has been and are still in prison etc.
 
Convictions staying on of you have more than one is crazy when it’s been over 10 years.

attributes.action: Introduce a goverment helpline for mental health
attributes.background: 1 in 4 people will expirence a mental health issue each year. Why don’t we have a goverment helpline, like 999, for people expirencing a problem or crisis? We need to do more to help people.

attributes.action: Exempt animals purchased from a rescue centre from VAT on vets bills
attributes.background: To discourage unnecessary breeding of animals which are over represented in rescue centres, I am asking that any animal purchased from a rescue centre should be exempt from the 20% VAT on vets’s bills and a corresponding reduction in their insurance premium.
attributes.additional_details:
This would encourage people to buy from rescue centres and discourage the breeding purely for money of those breeds which are over represented in rescue centres.
Owners would register proof of purchase from a recognised rescue centre with their vet and have their record marked as exempt from VAT.

attributes.action: Introduce unlimited compassionate leave for those with terminally ill relatives
attributes.background: My mother at the beginning of 2018 became seriously ill, and was admitted to hospital. Work was very good about it and gave me compassionate leave so I could go and see her
attributes.additional_details:
6/8/2018 I was told mum had only days left to live, but I was told I couldn’t have compassionate leave as I was not entitled to any and would have to phone in sick. 

I think it’s disrespectful not to be given compassionate leave for a dying relative, my mum passed that week. And basically lost two weeks wages. I think this is wrong for anyone to go through.

Unlimited compassionate leave for those with terminally ill relatives, would solve this issue for a lot of people.

attributes.action: Make selling a new house without building regulation sign-off illegal.
attributes.background: New build houses are being sold without a buildings regulation approval certificate being handed over on completion. Make selling a new build house that has not been signed off by building control illegal and a prosecutable offence.

attributes.action: Make smoking while driving illegal
attributes.background: The amount of people that have been killed in forest fires or road traffic collisions is astounding. This is all because someone throws their cigarette butt out of the window of the car. Or is not focusing while driving. I.e trying to light a cigarette.

attributes.action: Stop under 18s using social media and dating sites until age verified
attributes.background: Stop all under 18s using social media and dating sites until age verified at 18 same as gambling sites to eliminate child grooming and paedophile activity
attributes.additional_details: Girls are adding random guys all over the world and sending illicit photos of themselves and sexting my daughter was 1 of these at the age of 16 I have now took all media off her including her phone but I would like it stopped nationally as it's unsafe for any child

attributes.action: Redefine the term ‘majority’ in regards to referendums as a minimum of 65%.
attributes.background: 52% is NOT  majority; this means that the will of a significant portion of the population goes unheeded. The government needs to redefine the term 'majority' in a referendum to 65% minimum.
attributes.additional_details:
In other countries, such as the US, a major change to the constitution requires two-thirds majority in both the Senate and House of Representatives. The fact that in the UK a result of just over 50% can constitute a major change can and has led to major social divisions within the country whilst also meaning that the will of a significant portion of the population goes unheeded. This makes the country vulnerable to disinformation.

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36306681

attributes.action: Create a single register of eligible voters managed by the Electoral Commission
attributes.background:
Currently local registration offices manage over 350 electoral rolls in the UK.

This petition calls for creation of a single register to be managed by the independent Electoral Commission.

Such a register would help promote public confidence in the democratic process and ensure its integrity.

attributes.action: Ban plastic food containers at takeaways, food pots and trays
attributes.background: According to World Environmental Forum, we have become too depended on using plastics. More than 8 million tons of it ends up in the ocean every year. If we continue to pollute at this rate, there will be more plastic than fish in the ocean by 2050,”
attributes.additional_details:
Many countries around the world have banned the use of plastics. The U.K. must take action now!

Time is up for plastic use! We must protect our ocean and the next generation!
#Banplasticuse4good #Banplasticfoodpots #Banplastictakeawayboxes

Plastic food pots and trays are often unrecyclable, say councils - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-45058971

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all meat products to carry an image of the animal killed
attributes.background: People disassociate the meat that they eat with the animal that has been killed. The compulsory labelling of meat products with an image of the animal that has been killed will mean people need to acknowledge that an animal has died for the meat or animal product that they eat.

attributes.action: Children who are registered for home education to have mandatory welfare checks.
attributes.background: When a child is removed from the school roll and registered for home education, there is a loss of the safeguarding layer of that child that teachers and schools currently provide. Parents have no legal obligation to let education department visit the home and determine if a suitable environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Children who are home schooled are at risk of becoming hidden children, with the opportunity to identify risks to their welfare in their home environment severely diminished. 
A simple welfare check on a monthly or quarterly basis would be key to preventing these scenarios.

attributes.action: Government to amend rules so GPs can charge Solicitors for postage for SAR.
attributes.background: GDPR has put a financial burden of £25 for postage on GP Practices for Subject Access Requests (SAR) for litigation cases from Solicitors. Solicitors are capitalising on this as opposed to requesting Access To Medical Records which carries a fee. GP time to remove sensitive data is not recoverable.
attributes.additional_details:
Historically practices could charge up to £50.00 to cover the consumables and postage charges. 
Solicitors are requesting information under a SAR request despite it clearly being for litigation. Patients are consenting to full medical records which under data protection is excessive in line with the Caldecott principals.

attributes.action: provide free water for everyone on the street of UK in this extreme hot weather
attributes.background: I think water must be free in this hot weather for everyone specially homeless people living on the street. The government must provide funding to local councils to facilitate the supply of free water in the street on UK. The local government must help local shops to provide water to everyone.
attributes.additional_details: The condition is extremely hot and people can get dehydrated and homeless people are at higher risk. Water must be provided by the local government in form of a water fountain or local shops providing them by local council finding them. This is a government’s duty to keep their people safe.

attributes.action: Require drivers over the age of 65 to retake their driving test
attributes.background: As people get older, their reaction times may slow down and their vision may become impaired.

attributes.action: Abolish business rates in favour of sales tax to rejuvenate town centres.
attributes.background: Town centres are dying because of crippling business rates so a sales tax makes sense to reduce burdens on start up businesses.

attributes.action: All Diabetes sufferers should be entitled to free dental treatment
attributes.background: I was diagnosed with Type II Diabetes in 2016. I hadn't required any dental treatment for over 10 years but suddenly felt that my gums were receding. The dentist later told me that diabetic people are very prone to gum disease. Besides free eye tests and feet checks, dental care should be included.
attributes.additional_details:
People with diabetes are at greater risk for dental problems.

They're more likely to have infections of their gums and the bones that hold their teeth in place, because diabetes can reduce the blood supply to the gums.

High blood sugar may also cause dry mouth and make gum disease worse. Less saliva can allow more tooth-decaying bacteria and plaque buildup.

attributes.action: Strip abusive parents of parental rights
attributes.background: Many parents are in impossible situations and have to meet face-to-face with an abuser who has parental rights. As soon as a parent is accused of such a thing, contact should be supervised and if convicted they should lose parental rights.
attributes.additional_details: I just want justice for all parents who have been abused mentally or physically, to give them chance to live.

attributes.action: Abolish International Student Fees and Finance Ineligibility for UK Citizens
attributes.background: The prerequisite three year residence in the UK deprives British citizens from the ability to access Student Finance, meaning that families have to attempt to pay the massive fees on their own. This disadvantages domestic students, and is unfair on those who possess British passports and citizenship
attributes.additional_details: I moved back to the UK from overseas in June 2017, and wish to apply for university in 2019, once I have completed A Levels. I was born in Kings-Lynn, Norfolk, and have possessed a British passport all my life. Having never lived under another nationality, or been a permanent resident of any foreign country, to find out that I am classed as an international student within my own borders is upsetting, and is a disadvantage for me, as I now cannot afford higher education, or find myself a job.

attributes.action: Abolish the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991
attributes.background: Thousands of unwanted dogs (primarily Pitbulls) are put down because of the Dangerous Dogs Act which makes it illegal for breeds which are classified as 'dangerous' to be rehomed to a loving owner and have to be euthanized if they become unwanted by their original owner.

attributes.action: Raise the stamp duty on second homes and onwards to 50% to fund home building.
attributes.background: House prices are too high for first time buyers. Funds raised by stamp duty on second homes can be used to build new affordable homes.

attributes.action: New high speed rail link parkway station for Maidstone
attributes.background: The HS1 link bypasses Maidstone and the town is at a disadvantage to other Kent towns in investment and travel provision. A new parkway station could be accessed from the A229 and would serve both Maidstone and the surrounding towns. There should have been a station when it was first developed.
attributes.additional_details: The HS1 high speed rail line runs north of Maidstone, providing faster travel links to Ebbslfeet and Ashford as well as towns further away such as Canterbury and Margate, but the County Town receives no benefit. Investment in Ashford and Ebbsfleet is significantly greater than Maidstone and the town still suffers from a poor and very slow train service to London compared to other towns outside of London. It takes twice as long to reach London from Maidstone than from Ashford which is ridiculous.

attributes.action: Ban alcohol and gambling sponsors in sport.
attributes.background:
Our nation is getting worse with alcohol and gambling, young children, teens are being exposed to bad influences that it is good to drink alcohol and gamble as it is good to watch sport such as football. Children are seeing this as a norm and have become addicts.
It is time to stop this.

attributes.action: Offer more funding to suicide and self-harm charities.
attributes.background: The rates of suicide and self-harm cases are extremely alarming in present day. Whilst there are charitable organisations trying to combat these issues, there is more than can be done. With the digital age that we currently live in, more can be done to ensure that these charities are being utilised.
attributes.additional_details: Potentially, phone companies being required to install these numbers in people's phone books, mandatory app's with the information. The help is there, but people need to know it's there.

attributes.action: Immediate cap on fees charged by letting agents
attributes.background: The rental market is open to abuse by letting agents who can name their price; there is no correlation between the costs they incur and the fees charged. It's a free for all, with fees for the same processes widely differing for no apparent reason but to put more money in the pocket of the agent.
attributes.additional_details:
Do these examples seem fair?

Print & sign tenancy contract: £120
What does it really cost to print a document?

Credit check: £100
Credit checks typically cost less than £30

Moving in fee covering background & credit check: £395
That's £395 BEFORE you've even paid your rent & deposit. And if you 'fail' you lose your money.

We're not proposing scrapping the fees, after all the agents do incur costs. But a cap would give clarity for all, and prevent profiteering hitting renters in the pocket.

attributes.action: Give all carers with SGO the same allowance regardless of income
attributes.background:
Carers with SGOs keep children out of the care system.  Some of us get an allowance, others don't.  
We get deductions from these allowances, yet we do the same as foster carers who get larger allowances. 
We have the additional issues of emotional attatchement to these children.
attributes.additional_details:
We care for children who have a lot of emotional issues,  we keep them out of the care system because we have a heart and love these children as if they were our own. Yet we get penalised for this, some SGO carers get no help bringing these children up and giving them the life every child deserves.
The government should not make deductions to allowances and should make the allowance the same for every carer regardless of income.

attributes.action: Lower the university fee for all students! By atleast £1000
attributes.background: Students are thinking about university as summer starts however most are drawn back due to the large amount of cash they have to pay per year! The goverment need to start deciding what to put their money on wisely if they want a bright future for the UK.

attributes.action: Allegations of workplace bullying against John Bercow should be investigated.
attributes.background: John Bercow, the Speaker of the House of Commons, has been accused of workplace bullying. MPs have rejected the proposal of an investigation into these claims.  The accusations against the Speaker need to be investigated. Those elected to the House of Commons must be accountable for their behaviour.

attributes.action: Stop traumatising images on cigarette and tobacco packaging
attributes.background: The pictures are explicit pictures of children on the packaging of cigarettes and tobbaco. There is also one of an adult blowing smoke into a baby’s face. People have to look at these pictures in their everyday life and can be traumatising for many people.
attributes.additional_details: To stop the printing of child abuse and half dead children on cigarette packaging. It’s absolutely absurd that this would even be considered. Let alone commissioned within the UK. How this would benefit anyone I don’t know. It’s basically forcing people to look at these images. And should not be legal. It shows the mentality that plagues the English governing system today.

attributes.action: Debt agencies should only charge a small percentage fee for recovery of any debt
attributes.background: Companies and debt agencies should only be allowed to charge a very small percentage fee for any recovery of debts.
attributes.additional_details: Debt is a nationwide epidemic, companies and debt agencies have been exploiting people’s financial difficulties, and charging excessive amounts of money to recover any debt, often pushing people into further debt, and even bankruptcies and/or debt relief orders. Writing people off financially for years and sometimes preventing them from ever getting back on there financial feet again. Debt is a very stressful, experience causing anxiety, depression and even suicides. It’s time to change the la !

attributes.action: Refund 50% of 2018 car tax to offset the cost to Motorists and Motorbike Riders
attributes.background:
Due to the Extreme weather conditions 
The UK Roads are at their worst condition for years and are filled with potholes and loose chipping that are causing untold damage to suspension and tyres. This heavy cost of repair is a burden. Councils have not carried out repairs so a refund should assist

attributes.action: Make it illegal to have alcohol at school events in which children are present.
attributes.background: Alcohol plays far too big a part in society as it is. Alcohol is a grown up thing that children should not be part of. By having alcohol at children's school events we are not only weakening the safeguarding of the children attending, but also showing them that we drink to have a good time.
attributes.additional_details:
Adults should be leading by good example. You can't teach responsible drinking while drinking in front of them. It should be respected that there are parents that want to raise their children in alcohol free environments. 
1 in 5 children are affected by a parents drinking this also needs to be taken into consideration, for some of those children school is a safe and fun environment. 
There is no argument for alcohol at schools, other than "we want it" However there are many disadvantages to it.

attributes.action: Free NHS prescriptions to families of Veterans who receive War Pensions AFCS
attributes.background: Veterans who have been awarded compensation for injuries sustained whilst serving this country are having to pay for NHS prescriptions due to their income being over the benefit rate.There is an employability supplement that equates to the ESA payment yet without the benefits of free healthcare.

attributes.action: Require all businesses who sell food to provide dairy alternatives
attributes.background: A growing number of children are being daignosed with dairy intolerance. Wouldn't it be nice to stop at your local ice cream parlour and be able to buy a dairy alternative ice cream or take your diary intolerant child out for a milkshake at any cafe without having to check with them first?
attributes.additional_details: Seems such a small thing but trying to explain to a little boy he can't have an ice cream on the seafront but the other children can is heart breaking. I believe it's about time businesses were forced to supply an alternative to dairy to meet the growing needs of intolerant children and adults.
